head.title: Climate Change Imposes Heavy Financial Cost; Fuel Cell and Emissions

hedline.hl1: Climate Change Imposes Heavy Financial Cost; Fuel Cell and Emissions

abstract.p: Morris Altschuler letter disputes October 8 Business Day article on advances in fuel cell technology (S)

block.p: Although fuel cells show promise for use in electric vehicles, your Oct. 8 Business Day article and the accompanying chart provide incomplete information on the subject.
Although fuel cells show promise for use in electric vehicles, your Oct. 8 Business Day article and the accompanying chart provide incomplete information on the subject.

The chart compares pollutants associated with fuel-cell motors and the battery-powered electric motor. It correctly says that in the case of the electric motor, the numbers are for ''emissions from generation of power to charge battery.'' However, for fuel cells it shows only emissions from using hydrogen gas, natural gas and methanol.

But what are the emissions resulting from the production of the hydrogen or methanol? These are not zero-emission processes. In addition, any system that involves the extensive use of methane must assume a leakage factor associated with its storage, transportation and use. Perhaps further research on fuel cells covering the total cycle should be conducted before they enter the electric vehicle market.
The writer is a chemical engineer.
